intro: Pleuradenia praecox, commonly known as the early pleuradenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It often grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface.
